definition: to block up (a road, pipe etc)/to stop up (a hole)/(fig.) (of a person) choked up with anxiety or stress/wall (literary)/(classifier for walls)
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: The sink was stopped up with hair and fragments of cloth.
sentences.chinese: 洗涤槽被头发和破布片给堵住了。

sentences.english: The soldiers used their bodies to plug up a hole in the dyke.
sentences.chinese: 战士们用身体堵住大堤的裂口。

sentences.english: A move to fiscal union is [a closing] of this loophole.
sentences.chinese: 朝着财政联盟的推进是一种堵住这一漏洞的做法。

sentences.english: There he lay, sprawled across the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 他四仰八叉地躺在那儿，堵住了门廊。

sentences.english: He bricked up the hole in the wall.
The revolving door between Washington and Wall Street needs to be jammed.
sentences.chinese: 华盛顿与华尔街之间的旋转门亦需被堵住。

sentences.english: Hearing that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, the Pharisees got together.
sentences.chinese: 法利赛人听见耶稣堵住了撒都该人的口，他们就聚集。

sentences.english: Check the oil filter to see if it is plugged up with gunk.
sentences.chinese: 检查油过滤器是否被粘性物质堵住。

sentences.english: a lock which stuck, drains clogged with my thick hair.
sentences.chinese: 一撮粘住的毛发，下水道被我浓密的头发堵住。

sentences.english: On the afternoon of the same day, more than 200 people blocked Pangyo street office.
sentences.chinese: 当日下午，200余人堵住了大板桥街道办。

sentences.english: See the thing is, artists seem to get in the way of the music. Get out of the way of the music.
sentences.chinese: 事情是这样的，艺术家似乎常把音乐的路堵住了。

sentences.english: Once the leak is stanched, BP could permanently seal the first well.
sentences.chinese: 一旦漏缝被堵住，就可以永远封锁第一口井。

sentences.english: Two come out onto the trail ahead of him.
sentences.chinese: 有两只在他的前面堵住去路。

sentences.english: He was gagged by the kidnappers.
sentences.chinese: 他的嘴被绑架者堵住了。

sentences.english: All the windows were bricked up.
He stanched the leak of the boat with a piece of cloth.
sentences.chinese: 他用一块布堵住了船上的漏洞。

definition: to block (a road)/to plug (a hole)/to stop up
to block up (a road, pipe etc)/to stop up (a hole)/(fig.) (of a person) choked up with anxiety or stress/wall (literary)/(classifier for walls)
to jam/to choke/to clutch/also pr. [qia3 zhu4]
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
